column2: WEST VIRGINIA DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST

1. Passing is prohibited:
column4: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.
column8: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.

4. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column6: having them checked by a mechanic.

column2: 5. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column6: on the left shoulder of the road.
column8: near the left edge of the road.

column2: 6. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
7. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column6: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.
column8: they already are within the intersection.

column2: 8. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column8: when it is hard to see ahead.

column2: 9. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column6: Stay on the main highway if possible
column10: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

column2: 11. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column6: you must wait for the red light to turn green.
column10: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.

column2: 12. Emergency vehicles:
column4: may use a loudspeaker to give instructions.
column8: have the right-of-way when using siren and red/blue lights.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column8: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 14. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column4: gives you time to react to situations.
column6: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.

column2: 15. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column6: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: There are four stop signs at the intersection.

column2: 16. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: pass the car on the left.
column6: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.
column8: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column10: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.

column2: 17. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
18. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
19. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column4: to look for road edge markings to guide you.
column10: to turn on your windshield wipers.

column2: 20. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.
